titleStmt.title: Despatch from Abraham Hanson to William H. Seward, December 31, 1862

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.title: Despatch from Abraham Hanson to William H. Seward
Despatches from United States Consuls in Monrovia, 1852-1906

div1.p:
To the Honorable William H. Seward,
Sec. of State of U.S. of America,
I have the honor to inform you that I have this day drawn upon you for six and 92/100 Dollars, at fifteen days sight, acceptance waived, on account of stationery & postage
I have the honor to enclose a statement of account, and also one voucher in due form. Together with the usual form of receipt
I have the honor to enclose a statement of account, and also one voucher in due form, together with the usual form of receipt

I have the honor to remain
With Sincere Respect
Your very Obed. Servant
Abm Hanson
U.S. Com. Agent

U.S. Commercial Agency
Monrovia, Dec 31, 1862
Abm Hanson, Com Agent
